poem:
### Words in the Air

Words carry weight  
on tongues like stones  
flung to bruise—  
yet some wield them  
as feathers  
gently falling,  
telling stories  
of loss, of joy.  
Can language bind us  
or set us free?  
To lift, to scar—  
a choice to see  
the soul beyond  
a word's decree.
